title: How to Draw the Internal Structure of the Heart

steps.title: To find a good diagram, go to Google Images, and type in "The Internal Structure of the Human Heart".
steps.content: To find a good diagram, go to Google Images, and type in "The Internal Structure of the Human Heart". Find an image that displays the entire heart, and click on it to enlarge it. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Find a piece of paper and something to draw with.
steps.content: Find a piece of paper and something to draw with. Start with the pulmonary veins. They will be to the lower left of the Aorta. There are two of them. Draw the top vein slightly smaller than the bottom vein.

steps.title: Below the pulmonary veins, and slightly to the right, begin sketching the bottom of the inferior vena cava.
steps.content: Below the pulmonary veins, and slightly to the right, begin sketching the bottom of the inferior vena cava.

steps.title: Begin sketching the base of the heart, including the right and left ventricles, and the right and left atriums.
steps.content: Begin sketching the base of the heart, including the right and left ventricles, and the right and left atriums. The pulmonary veins should be adjacent to the right atrium, and the inferior vena cava should be adjacent to the right atrium and right ventricle. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Change diagrams if needed.
steps.content: Change diagrams if needed. If the diagram that you are using is helping you to sketch the heart, you should continue to use the same diagram. If you are confused about where parts of the heart are, find a new diagram.

steps.title: Draw the other side of the pulmonary veins, and add circles at the end.
steps.content: Draw the other side of the pulmonary veins, and add circles at the end.

steps.title: Begin drawing the pulmonary artery.
steps.content: Begin drawing the pulmonary artery. Bottom ends at the top of the right ventricle. The left and right sides should be slightly above the atriums and pulmonary veins. The pulmonary artery is shaped like an uppercase 't'. It extends to the top of the right ventricle. Draw a circle at the end of it at the bottom. [3] X Research source

steps.title: To draw the aorta, begin by drawing the loop over and around the pulmonary artery, ending at the top of the left ventricle.
steps.content: To draw the aorta, begin by drawing the loop over and around the pulmonary artery, ending at the top of the left ventricle. To draw the back of the aorta, draw a single line connecting from the right side of the pulmonary artery to the top of the left atrium. To finish drawing the aorta, draw three nubs at the top of the loop. After you draw these, erase the lines connecting from one side of the bottom of the nub to the other. Add tilted circles to the top of all of the nubs. Draw a circle at the bottom of the aorta, adjacent to the left ventricle.

steps.title: To draw the superior vena cava, draw a nub extending from the top of the right atrium, overlapping the left side of the pulmonary artery, to slightly above the left side of the pulmonary artery.
steps.content: To draw the superior vena cava, draw a nub extending from the top of the right atrium, overlapping the left side of the pulmonary artery, to slightly above the left side of the pulmonary artery. At the bottom of the superior vena cava, adjacent to the right atrium, draw a circle.

steps.title: Draw four circles in the left atrium, and one circle in the right atrium, slightly below the superior vena cava.
steps.content: Draw four circles in the left atrium, and one circle in the right atrium, slightly below the superior vena cava.

steps.title: Draw the mitral valves between both atriums, and aortic valves in both the pulmonary artery and the aorta.
steps.content: Draw the mitral valves between both atriums, and aortic valves in both the pulmonary artery and the aorta.

steps.title: Color these pink:
steps.content: Color these pink: [4] X Research source Border Left Atrium Right Atrium Pulmonary Veins

steps.title: Color these purple:
steps.content: Color these purple: [5] X Research source Pulmonary Artery Left Ventricle Right Ventricle

steps.title: Color these blue:
steps.content: Color these blue: [6] X Research source Superior Vena Cava Inferior Vena Cava

steps.title: Color this red:
steps.content: Color this red: [7] X Research source Aorta

steps.title: Make sure to label the following:
steps.content: Make sure to label the following: [8] X Research source Superior Vena Cava Inferior Vena Cava Pulmonary Artery Pulmonary Veins Left Ventricle Right Ventricle Left Atrium Right Atrium Mitral Valves Aortic Valves Aorta Pulmonic Valve (Optional) Tricuspid Valve (Optional)

steps.title: To finish, label "The Human Heart" above the sketch.
steps.content: To finish, label "The Human Heart" above the sketch.
